  • Road Signage
  • View page source

Road Signage

Road signage is considered an “actor” in Virtual Self-Driving Car Studio. The road signage library controls the road signage available to be placed in the QLabs environment. Road signage can be spawned anywhere in the Open Worlds.

See the Road Signage Tutorial to get a better understanding of using road signage in Quanser Interactive Labs.

Contents:

  • Road Signage
    • Crosswalk
    • Roundabout Sign
    • Stop Sign
    • Yield Sign
    • Traffic Cone
    • Traffic Light

Crosswalk

Library

class library_qlabs_crosswalk.QLabsCrosswalk(qlabs, verbose=False)[source]

This class is for spawning crosswalks.

Constants

QLabsCrosswalk.ID_CROSSWALK = 10010

Class ID

Member Variables

QLabsCrosswalk.actorNumber = None

The current actor number of this class to be addressed. This will be set by spawn methods and cleared by destroy methods. It will not be modified by the destroy all actors. This can be manually altered at any time to use one object to address multiple actors.

Methods

QLabsCrosswalk.spawn(location=[0, 0, 0], rotation=[0, 0, 0], scale=[1, 1, 1], configuration=0, waitForConfirmation=True)

Spawns a new actor with the next available actor number within this class.

Parameters

  • location (float array[3]) – (Optional) An array of floats for x, y and z coordinates

  • rotation (float array[3]) – (Optional) An array of floats for the roll, pitch, and yaw in radians

  • scale (float array[3]) – (Optional) An array of floats for the scale in the x, y, and z directions. Scale values of 0.0 should not be used.

  • configuration (uint32) – (Optional) Spawn configuration. See class library for configuration options.

  • waitForConfirmation (boolean) – (Optional) Make this operation blocking until confirmation of the spawn has occurred. Note that if this is False, the returned actor number will be invalid.

Returns

  • status - 0 if successful, 1 class not available, 3 unknown error, -1 communications error.

  • actorNumber - An actor number to use for future references.

Return type

int32, int32

QLabsCrosswalk.spawn_degrees(location=[0, 0, 0], rotation=[0, 0, 0], scale=[1, 1, 1], configuration=0, waitForConfirmation=True)

Spawns a new actor with the next available actor number within this class.

Parameters

  • location (float array[3]) – (Optional) An array of floats for x, y and z coordinates

  • rotation (float array[3]) – (Optional) An array of floats for the roll, pitch, and yaw in degrees

  • scale (float array[3]) – (Optional) An array of floats for the scale in the x, y, and z directions. Scale values of 0.0 should not be used.

  • configuration (uint32) – (Optional) Spawn configuration. See class library for configuration options.

  • waitForConfirmation (boolean) – (Optional) Make this operation blocking until confirmation of the spawn has occurred. Note that if this is False, the returned actor number will be invalid.

Returns

  • status - 0 if successful, 1 class not available, 3 unknown error, -1 communications error.

  • actorNumber - An actor number to use for future references.

Return type

int32, int32

QLabsCrosswalk.spawn_id(actorNumber, location=[0, 0, 0], rotation=[0, 0, 0], scale=[1, 1, 1], configuration=0, waitForConfirmation=True)

Spawns a new actor.

Parameters

  • actorNumber (uint32) – User defined unique identifier for the class actor in QLabs

  • location (float array[3]) – (Optional) An array of floats for x, y and z coordinates

  • rotation (float array[3]) – (Optional) An array of floats for the roll, pitch, and yaw in radians

  • scale (float array[3]) – (Optional) An array of floats for the scale in the x, y, and z directions. Scale values of 0.0 should not be used.

  • configuration (uint32) – (Optional) Spawn configuration. See class library for configuration options.

  • waitForConfirmation (boolean) – (Optional) Make this operation blocking until confirmation of the spawn has occurred.

Returns

  • status - 0 if successful, 1 class not available, 2 actor number not available or already in use, 3 unknown error, -1 communications error

Return type

int32

QLabsCrosswalk.spawn_id_degrees(actorNumber, location=[0, 0, 0], rotation=[0, 0, 0], scale=[1, 1, 1], configuration=0, waitForConfirmation=True)

Spawns a new actor.

Parameters

  • actorNumber (uint32) – User defined unique identifier for the class actor in QLabs

  • location (float array[3]) – (Optional) An array of floats for x, y and z coordinates

  • rotation (float array[3]) – (Optional) An array of floats for the roll, pitch, and yaw in radians

  • scale (float array[3]) – (Optional) An array of floats for the scale in the x, y, and z directions. Scale values of 0.0 should not be used.

  • configuration (uint32) – (Optional) Spawn configuration. See class library for configuration options.

  • waitForConfirmation (boolean) – (Optional) Make this operation blocking until confirmation of the spawn has occurred.

Returns

  • status - 0 if successful, 1 class not available, 2 actor number not available or already in use, 3 unknown error, -1 communications error

Return type

int32

QLabsCrosswalk.spawn_id_and_parent_with_relative_transform(actorNumber, location=[0, 0, 0], rotation=[0, 0, 0], scale=[1, 1, 1], configuration=0, parentClassID=0, parentActorNumber=0, parentComponent=0, waitForConfirmation=True)

Spawns a new actor relative to an existing actor and creates an kinematic relationship.

Parameters

  • actorNumber (uint32) – User defined unique identifier for the class actor in QLabs

  • location (float array[3]) – (Optional) An array of floats for x, y and z coordinates

  • rotation (float array[3]) – (Optional) An array of floats for the roll, pitch, and yaw in radians

  • scale (float array[3]) – (Optional) An array of floats for the scale in the x, y, and z directions. Scale values of 0.0 should not be used.

  • configuration (uint32) – (Optional) Spawn configuration. See class library for configuration options.

  • parentClassID (uint32) – See the ID variables in the respective library classes for the class identifier

  • parentActorNumber (uint32) – User defined unique identifier for the class actor in QLabs

  • parentComponent (uint32) – 0 for the origin of the parent actor, see the parent class for additional reference frame options

  • waitForConfirmation (boolean) – (Optional) Make this operation blocking until confirmation of the spawn has occurred.

Returns

  • status - 0 if successful, 1 class not available, 2 actor number not available or already in use, 3 cannot find the parent actor, 4 unknown error, -1 communications error

Return type

int32

QLabsCrosswalk.spawn_id_and_parent_with_relative_transform_degrees(actorNumber, location=[0, 0, 0], rotation=[0, 0, 0], scale=[1, 1, 1], configuration=0, parentClassID=0, parentActorNumber=0, parentComponent=0, waitForConfirmation=True)

Spawns a new actor relative to an existing actor and creates an kinematic relationship.

Parameters

  • actorNumber (uint32) – User defined unique identifier for the class actor in QLabs

  • location (float array[3]) – (Optional) An array of floats for x, y and z coordinates

  • rotation (float array[3]) – (Optional) An array of floats for the roll, pitch, and yaw in degrees

  • scale (float array[3]) – (Optional) An array of floats for the scale in the x, y, and z directions. Scale values of 0.0 should not be used.

  • configuration (uint32) – (Optional) Spawn configuration. See class library for configuration options.

  • parentClassID (uint32) – See the ID variables in the respective library classes for the class identifier

  • parentActorNumber (uint32) – User defined unique identifier for the class actor in QLabs

  • parentComponent (uint32) – 0 for the origin of the parent actor, see the parent class for additional reference frame options

  • waitForConfirmation (boolean) – (Optional) Make this operation blocking until confirmation of the spawn has occurred.

Returns

  • status - 0 if successful, 1 class not available, 2 actor number not available or already in use, 3 cannot find the parent actor, 4 unknown error, -1 communications error

Return type

int32

QLabsCrosswalk.destroy()

Find and destroy a specific actor. This is a blocking operation.

Returns

  • numActorsDestroyed - The number of actors destroyed. -1 if failed.

Return type

int32

QLabsCrosswalk.destroy_all_actors_of_class()

Find and destroy all actors of this class. This is a blocking operation.

Returns

  • numActorsDestroyed - The number of actors destroyed. -1 if failed.

Return type

int32

QLabsCrosswalk.ping()

Checks if the actor is still present in the environment. Note that if you did not spawn the actor with one of the spawn functions, you may need to manually set the actorNumber member variable.

Returns

  • status - True if successful, False otherwise

Return type

boolean

QLabsCrosswalk.get_world_transform()

Get the location, rotation, and scale in world coordinates of the actor.

Returns

  • status - True if successful, False otherwise

  • location

  • rotation

  • scale

Return type

boolean, float array[3], float array[3], float array[3]

QLabsCrosswalk.get_world_transform_degrees()

Get the location, rotation, and scale in world coordinates of the actor.

Returns

  • status - True if successful, False otherwise

  • location

  • rotation

  • scale

Return type

boolean, float array[3], float array[3], float array[3]

Configurations

There are 3 different configurations (0-2) available for crosswalks generated in QLabs.

Connection Points

There are no connection points for this actor class.

Connection Points

There are no connection points for this actor class.

Library

class library_qlabs_stop_sign.QLabsStopSign(qlabs, verbose=False)[source]

This class is for spawning stop signs.

QLabsStopSign.actorNumber = None

The current actor number of this class to be addressed. This will be set by spawn methods and cleared by destroy methods. It will not be modified by the destroy all actors. This can be manually altered at any time to use one object to address multiple actors.

Yield Sign

Library

class library_qlabs_yield_sign.QLabsYieldSign(qlabs, verbose=False)[source]

This class is for spawning yield signs.

Constants

QLabsYieldSign.ID_YIELD_SIGN = 10070

Class ID

Member Variables

QLabsYieldSign.actorNumber = None

The current actor number of this class to be addressed. This will be set by spawn methods and cleared by destroy methods. It will not be modified by the destroy all actors. This can be manually altered at any time to use one object to address multiple actors.

Methods

QLabsYieldSign.spawn(location=[0, 0, 0], rotation=[0, 0, 0], scale=[1, 1, 1], configuration=0, waitForConfirmation=True)

Spawns a new actor with the next available actor number within this class.

Parameters

  • location (float array[3]) – (Optional) An array of floats for x, y and z coordinates

  • rotation (float array[3]) – (Optional) An array of floats for the roll, pitch, and yaw in radians

  • scale (float array[3]) – (Optional) An array of floats for the scale in the x, y, and z directions. Scale values of 0.0 should not be used.

  • configuration (uint32) – (Optional) Spawn configuration. See class library for configuration options.

  • waitForConfirmation (boolean) – (Optional) Make this operation blocking until confirmation of the spawn has occurred. Note that if this is False, the returned actor number will be invalid.

Returns

  • status - 0 if successful, 1 class not available, 3 unknown error, -1 communications error.

  • actorNumber - An actor number to use for future references.

Return type

int32, int32

QLabsYieldSign.spawn_degrees(location=[0, 0, 0], rotation=[0, 0, 0], scale=[1, 1, 1], configuration=0, waitForConfirmation=True)

QLabsYieldSign.spawn_id_and_parent_with_relative_transform(actorNumber, location=[0, 0, 0], rotation=[0, 0, 0], scale=[1, 1, 1], configuration=0, parentClassID=0, parentActorNumber=0, parentComponent=0, waitForConfirmation=True)

Spawns a new actor relative to an existing actor and creates an kinematic relationship.

Parameters

  • actorNumber (uint32) – User defined unique identifier for the class actor in QLabs

  • location (float array[3]) – (Optional) An array of floats for x, y and z coordinates

  • rotation (float array[3]) – (Optional) An array of floats for the roll, pitch, and yaw in radians

  • scale (float array[3]) – (Optional) An array of floats for the scale in the x, y, and z directions. Scale values of 0.0 should not be used.

  • configuration (uint32) – (Optional) Spawn configuration. See class library for configuration options.

  • parentClassID (uint32) – See the ID variables in the respective library classes for the class identifier

  • parentActorNumber (uint32) – User defined unique identifier for the class actor in QLabs

  • parentComponent (uint32) – 0 for the origin of the parent actor, see the parent class for additional reference frame options

  • waitForConfirmation (boolean) – (Optional) Make this operation blocking until confirmation of the spawn has occurred.

Returns

  • status - 0 if successful, 1 class not available, 2 actor number not available or already in use, 3 cannot find the parent actor, 4 unknown error, -1 communications error

Return type

int32

  • status - True if successful, False otherwise

Traffic Cone

Library

class library_qlabs_traffic_cone.QLabsTrafficCone(qlabs, verbose=False)[source]

This class is for spawning traffic cones.

Constants

QLabsTrafficCone.ID_TRAFFIC_CONE = 10000

Class ID

Member Variables

QLabsTrafficCone.actorNumber = None

The current actor number of this class to be addressed. This will be set by spawn methods and cleared by destroy methods. It will not be modified by the destroy all actors. This can be manually altered at any time to use one object to address multiple actors.

Methods

Road Signage Tutorial

Example
  1"""
  2Road Signage Library Example
  3----------------------------
  4
  5.. note:: Make sure you have Quanser Interactive Labs open before running any of these examples.
  6
  7.. tip:: If you are struggling to get this example running check out our _Troubleshooting page.
  8
  9"""
 10
 11# imports to important libraries
 12import sys
 13import math
 14import time
 15sys.path.append('../libraries/')
 16
 17from library_qlabs import QuanserInteractiveLabs
 18from library_qlabs_free_camera import QLabsFreeCamera
 19from library_qlabs_crosswalk import QLabsCrosswalk
 20from library_qlabs_roundabout_sign import QLabsRoundaboutSign
 21from library_qlabs_yield_sign import QLabsYieldSign
 22from library_qlabs_stop_sign import QLabsStopSign 
 23from library_qlabs_traffic_cone import QLabsTrafficCone
 24from library_qlabs_traffic_light import QLabsTrafficLight
 25
 26# set any of these flags to False if you don't want to see the output
 27CROSSWALK_FLAG = True
 28ROUNDABOUT_FLAG = True
 29YIELDSIGN_FLAG = True
 30STOPSIGN_FLAG = True
 31TRAFFICCONE_FLAG = True
 32TRAFFICLIGHT_FLAG = True
 33
 34def crosswalk(qlabs):
 35    """This method demonstrates some basic commands with the crosswalk class"""
 36    
 37    # initialize a camera - See Camera Actor Library Reference for more information
 38    cameraCrosswalk = QLabsFreeCamera(qlabs)
 39    cameraCrosswalk.spawn(location=[-25.286, 46.167, 5.333], rotation=[-0, 0.239, -0.043])
 40    cameraCrosswalk.possess()
 41
 42    # create a crosswalk in this qlabs instance
 43    crosswalk = QLabsCrosswalk(qlabs)
 44
 45    # spawn crosswalk with radians in config
 46    crosswalk.spawn_id(actorNumber=0, location=[-15.788, 47.5, 0.00], rotation=[0,0,math.pi/2], scale=[1,1,1], configuration=0, waitForConfirmation=True)
 47    # waits so we can see the output
 48    time.sleep(1)
 49    # spawn crosswalk with degrees in config 1
 50    crosswalk.spawn_id_degrees(actorNumber=1, location=[-11.788, 47.5, 0.00], rotation=[0,0,90], scale=[1,1,1], configuration=1, waitForConfirmation=True)
 51    # waits so we can see the output
 52    time.sleep(1)
 53    # spawn crosswalk with degress in config 2
 54    crosswalk.spawn_id_degrees(actorNumber=2, location=[-7.8, 47.5, 0.0], rotation=[0,0,90], scale=[1,1,1], configuration=2, waitForConfirmation=True)
 55    
 56    # collecting the world transform coordinates of the crosswalk
 57    x, loc, rot, scale = crosswalk.get_world_transform()
 58    print( x, loc, rot, scale)
 59    
 60    # pinging existing sign - this should return True if we printed it
 61    crosswalk.ping()
 62   
 63
 64
 65def roundabout_sign(qlabs):
 66    """This method demonstrates some basic commands with the roundabout sign class"""
 67
 68    # create two roundabouts in this qlabs instance
 69    roundabout = QLabsRoundaboutSign(qlabs)
 70    roundabout2 = QLabsRoundaboutSign(qlabs)
 71
 72    # spawns the sign we just created using radians and specifying the actorNumber
 73    roundabout.spawn_id(actorNumber=0, location=[-17, 36, 0.0], rotation=[0, 0, math.pi], scale=[1,1,1], configuration=0, waitForConfirmation=True)    
 74    # spawns the second sign we just created using degrees and allowing the computer to 
 75    # generate an actorNumber internally
 76    roundabout2.spawn_id_degrees(actorNumber=2, location=[-15, 36, 0.0], rotation=[0,0,180], scale=[1,1,1], configuration=0, waitForConfirmation=True)
 77    
 78    # collecting the world transform coordinates of the roundabout sign
 79    x, loc, rot, scale = roundabout2.get_world_transform()
 80    print( x, loc, rot, scale)
 81
 82    # pinging existing sign - this should return True if we printed it
 83    roundabout2.ping()
 84    # waits so we can see the output
 85    time.sleep(1)
 86
 87    # destroying the sign we just created
 88    roundabout.destroy()
 89
 90
 91def yield_sign(qlabs):
 92    """This method demonstrates some basic commands with the yield sign class"""
 93
 94    # create two yieldsigns in this qlabs instance
 95    yieldsign = QLabsYieldSign(qlabs)
 96    yieldsign2 = QLabsYieldSign(qlabs)
 97
 98    # spawns the sign we just created using radians and specifying the actorNumber
 99    yieldsign.spawn_id(actorNumber=0, location=[-17, 38, 0.0], rotation=[0,0,math.pi], scale=[1,1,1], configuration=0, waitForConfirmation=True)
100    # spawns the second sign we just created using degrees and allowing the computer to 
101    # generate an actorNumber internally
102    yieldsign2.spawn_degrees(location=[-15, 38, 0.0], rotation=[0,0,180], scale=[1,1,1], configuration=0, waitForConfirmation=True)
103    
104    # collecting the world transform coordinates of the yield sign
105    x, loc, rot, scale = yieldsign2.get_world_transform()
106    print( x, loc, rot, scale)
107    
108    # pinging existing sign - this should return "True" if we printed it
109    yieldsign2.ping()
110    # waits so we can see the output
111    time.sleep(1) 
112
113    # destroying the sign we just created
114    yieldsign.destroy()
115
116
117def stop_sign(qlabs):
118    """This method demonstrates some basic commands with the stop sign class"""
119
120    # create two stop signs in this qlabs instance
121    stop = QLabsStopSign(qlabs)
122    stop2 = QLabsStopSign(qlabs)
123    # spawns the sign we just created using radians
124    stop.spawn_id(actorNumber=1, location=[-16, 37, 0.0], rotation=[0,0,math.pi], scale=[1,1,1], configuration=0, waitForConfirmation=True)
125    # spawns the second sign we just created using degrees and generating the actorNumber internally
126    stop2.spawn_degrees(location=[-15, 37, 0.0], rotation=[0,0,180], scale=[1,1,1], configuration=0, waitForConfirmation=True)
127    
128    # collecting the world transform coordinates of the stop sign
129    x, loc, rot, scale = stop2.get_world_transform()
130    print(x, loc, rot, scale)
131    
132    # pinging existing sign - this should return True if we printed it
133    stop2.ping()
134    # waits so we can see the output
135    time.sleep(1)
136
137    # destroying the sign we just created
138    stop.destroy()
139    
140
141def traffic_cone(qlabs):
142    """This method demonstrates some basic commands with the traffic cone class"""
143
144    # creates 3 cones in this qlabs instance
145    cone = QLabsTrafficCone(qlabs)
146    cone1 = QLabsTrafficCone(qlabs)
147    cone2 = QLabsTrafficCone(qlabs)
148
149    # spawns a small traffic cone we just initialized using radians
150    cone.spawn(location=[-17, 35, 1.0], rotation=[0,0,math.pi], scale=[1,1,1], configuration=0, waitForConfirmation=True)
151    # waits so we can see the output
152    time.sleep (1)
153    # destroy the cone we just made
154    cone.destroy()
155    # waits so we can see the output
156    time.sleep(1)
157    # spawns another small traffic cone we just initialized using radians in the same place
158    cone1.spawn_id(actorNumber=1, location=[-17, 35, 1.0], rotation=[0,0,math.pi], scale=[1,1,1], configuration=0, waitForConfirmation=True)
159    # spawns a construction pylon using the cone we just initialized using degrees and generating 
160    # the actorNumber internally
161    cone2.spawn_degrees(location=[-15, 35, 1.0], rotation=[0,0,180], scale=[1,1,1], configuration=1, waitForConfirmation=True)
162   
163    # collecting the world transform coordinates of the traffic cone
164    x, loc, rot, scale = cone2.get_world_transform()
165    print(x, loc, rot, scale)
166    
167    # pinging existing cone - this should return True if we printed it
168    cone2.ping()
169
170
171def traffic_light(qlabs):
172    """This method demonstrates some basic commands with the traffic light class"""
173
174    # initialize a camera - See Camera Actor Library Reference for more information
175    cameraTraffic = QLabsFreeCamera(qlabs)
176    cameraTraffic.spawn(location=[-6.891, 3.568, 2.127], rotation=[0, 0.049, 1.105])
177    cameraTraffic.possess()
178
179    # initialize three traffic light instances in qlabs
180    trafficLight = QLabsTrafficLight(qlabs)
181    trafficLight2 = QLabsTrafficLight(qlabs)
182    trafficLight3 = QLabsTrafficLight(qlabs)
183
184    # spawn a traffic light in config 1 - vertical using radians and specifying a specific actorNumber
185    trafficLight.spawn_id(actorNumber=0, location=[-0.044, 17.715, 0.215], rotation=[0,0,0], scale=[1,1,1], configuration=0, waitForConfirmation=True)
186    # spawn a second traffic light using degrees in config 1 - vertical and specifying a specific actorNumber
187    trafficLight2.spawn_id_degrees(actorNumber=2, location=[-8.455, 17.527, 0.215], rotation=[0,0,180], scale=[1,1,1], configuration=1, waitForConfirmation=True)
188    # spawn traffic light using degrees in config 2 - horizontal and generating the actorNumber internally
189    trafficLight3.spawn_degrees(location=[-0.195, 7.261, 0.215], rotation=[0,0,-90], scale=[1,1,1], configuration=2, waitForConfirmation=True)
190    
191    # collecting the world transform coordinates of the traffic light
192    x, loc, rot, scale = trafficLight2.get_world_transform()
193    print(x, loc, rot, scale)
194    
195    # pinging existing traffic light - this should return True if we printed it
196    trafficLight2.ping()
197    
198    # changing the state of the traffic lights from green to red
199    trafficLight.set_state(state=trafficLight.STATE_GREEN, waitForConfirmation=True)
200    trafficLight2.set_state(state=trafficLight2.STATE_GREEN, waitForConfirmation=True)
201    trafficLight3.set_state(state=trafficLight3.STATE_RED, waitForConfirmation=True)
202
203    time.sleep(2)
204    
205    trafficLight.set_state(state=trafficLight.STATE_YELLOW, waitForConfirmation=True)
206    trafficLight2.set_state(state=trafficLight2.STATE_YELLOW, waitForConfirmation=True)
207
208    time.sleep(1)
209
210    trafficLight.set_state(state=trafficLight.STATE_RED, waitForConfirmation=True)
211    trafficLight2.set_state(state=trafficLight2.STATE_RED, waitForConfirmation=True)
212    
213    time.sleep(1)
214
215    trafficLight3.set_state(state=trafficLight3.STATE_GREEN, waitForConfirmation=True)
216
217    # destroying a traffic light
218    trafficLight.destroy()
219
220
221def main():
222    
223    # creates a server connection with Quanser Interactive Labs and manages the communications
224    qlabs = QuanserInteractiveLabs()
225
226    print("Connecting to QLabs...")
227    # trying to connect to QLabs and open the instance we have created - program will end if this fails
228    try:
229        qlabs.open("localhost")
230    except:
231        print("Unable to connect to QLabs")
232        return
233
234    # destroying any spawned actors in our QLabs that currently exist
235    qlabs.destroy_all_spawned_actors()
236
237    if CROSSWALK_FLAG == True:
238        crosswalk(qlabs)
239        time.sleep(2)
240
241    # switch the camera angle from whatever it was previous to be able to see where we will be 
242    # spawning the rest of the objects - see Camera Actor Library Reference for more information
243    if ROUNDABOUT_FLAG or YIELDSIGN_FLAG or STOPSIGN_FLAG or TRAFFICCONE_FLAG:
244        camera0 = QLabsFreeCamera(qlabs)
245        camera0.spawn(location=[-23.106, 37.257, 3.482], rotation=[0, 0.349, -0.04])
246        camera0.possess()
247
248        if ROUNDABOUT_FLAG:
249            roundabout_sign(qlabs)
250            time.sleep(1)
251        
252        if YIELDSIGN_FLAG:
253            yield_sign(qlabs)
254            time.sleep(1)
255        
256        if STOPSIGN_FLAG:
257            stop_sign(qlabs)
258            time.sleep(1)
259        
260        if TRAFFICCONE_FLAG:
261            traffic_cone(qlabs)
262            time.sleep(1)
263    
264    if TRAFFICLIGHT_FLAG:
265        traffic_light(qlabs)
266
267
268if __name__ == "__main__":
269    main()
270
